title: Starting, Taxiing, Towing and Parking
content:
Starting, Taxiing, Towing and Parking

State Regulations
§ 1261.40 - Aircraft to be positioned and taxied so that slip-stream or jet exhaust does not cause injury or damage
§ 1261.41 - Starting and warming-up of aircraft engines restricted to designated areas
§ 1261.42 - Presence of qualified attendant required before starting engine
§ 1261.43 - Aircraft to be started and run by qualified persons only
§ 1261.44 - Main landing wheels to be chocked and brakes locked prior to starting engine
§ 1261.45 - Operator of helicopter must be certificated
§ 1261.46 - Moving aircraft to be under control and moved at reasonable speed
§ 1261.47 - Moving aircraft to be in contact with tower
§ 1261.48 - Unattended aircraft to be secured in approved manner
§ 1261.49 - Unattended helicopters to be secured in approved manner
§ 1261.50 - Parked or stored aircraft to be moved upon request
§ 1261.51 - Taxing in or out of hangars prohibited
§ 1261.52 - Parked aircraft to have running lights on between sunset and sunrise; exception
§ 1261.53 - All moving aircraft to proceed with running lights on between sunset and sunrise

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
